revised_title: Focusing Effects in Two-Dimensional Supersonic Flow: A Geometrical Approach
tldr: The author investigates the steady, supersonic, irrotational, isentropic, two-dimensional flow of a perfect gas using a new geometrical method based on characteristic coordinates. The study focuses on the focusing effects, non-linear features, and discontinuities of the velocity gradient in supersonic flow fields. The method provides a qualitative and quantitative understanding of supersonic flow fields and helps predict limit lines and the formation of shockwaves.
